intro: Ludwigia cercodia, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are often submerged, while the flowers emerge above the water surface. Ludwigia cercodia is popular in aquariums due to its vibrant color and ease of cultivation.
